conversation.content:
[furious] Are you kidding me right now? Like, I wasn't even HERE on Tuesday—I mean, that was literally my day off, and somehow the flooded pit is MY fault? [pause] I was at my daughter's recital, for Christ's sake. You know, Harold saw the whole thing happen, right? He was, um, the one actually working that shift, but sure, [sarcastic] blame the guy who wasn't even on the property.

The thing is, I've been doing this for what—eight years? And I've never, [frustrated] NEVER had a site flood on my watch. Not once. But oh, suddenly I'm responsible for, like, weather patterns and drainage issues when I'm not even clocked in? [bitter] That's rich, honestly.

[shaky voice] I just—I don't know what he expects me to say here. "Sorry I didn't psychically predict the water main would burst while I was, uh, thirty miles away?" [angry] This is such bullshit. You know what, actually? Maybe if Roger actually fixed the drainage system I've been complaining about for, hmm, two years now, we wouldn't even—[trailing off]

[exhausted] Whatever. Just... whatever. I'll fill out the incident report saying it's somehow my fault, I guess. [sigh] Like that'll make any difference anyway.
